educational_objective: Identify the CT findings characteristic of polycystic kidney disease.
question_text: A 58-year-old man is evaluated for hypertension and progressive left flank pain.Abdominal CT scan is shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely cause of this patient's symptoms identified on CT is polycystic kidney disease (Option A). Abdominal CT scan in this patient with autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease shows enlarged kidneys with multiple bilateral cysts (appearing as hypodense lesions), with disruption of the architecture of the left kidney due to large cysts that make it minimally recognizable on imaging.
